line.originaltext: 4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
line.annotation: create_ing(ing0, "4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves")

line.originaltext: 1 cup milk
1 cup dry bread crumbs
1 cup grated Parmesan cheese
2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
1 cup olive oil
1 orange, sliced into rounds
1 cup dry white wine
1/2 cup orange juice
1 (10.5 ounce) can chicken broth
1/4 cup brandy-based orange liqueur (Grand Marnier®)
line.annotation: create_ing(ing10, "1/4 cup brandy-based orange liqueur (Grand Marnier®)")

line.originaltext: Slice chicken breasts in thirds horizontally to make 12 thin chicken fillets.
Slice chicken breasts in thirds horizontally to make 12 thin chicken fillets.
line.annotation: cut(ing0, t0, ing11, "12 thin chicken fillets", "slice in thirds horizontally")

line.originaltext: Lightly pound each piece.
line.annotation: do(ing11, , ing12, "12 pounded chicken fillets", "lightly pound each piece")

line.originaltext: Place in a dish, and pour milk over them.
Place in a dish, and pour milk over them.
Place in a dish, and pour milk over them.
Soak for 10 minutes.
In a shallow bowl, stir together the bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese and parsley.
In a shallow bowl, stir together the bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese and parsley.
line.annotation: combine({ing2, ing3, ing4}, ing14, "cheesy crumbs", "stir together")

line.originaltext: In a shallow bowl, stir together the bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese and parsley.
Set aside.
Heat olive oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat.
Heat olive oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat.
line.annotation: cook(ing5, t3, ing16, "hot oil", "heat over medium-high heat")

line.originaltext: Dredge chicken pieces in the bread crumb mixture, and place in the hot oil.
Dredge chicken pieces in the bread crumb mixture, and place in the hot oil.
Quickly brown on both sides, then remove to a buttered 9x13 inch baking dish, or similar size.
line.annotation: cook(ing18, t3, ing19, "browned chicken", "brown on both sides")

line.originaltext: Quickly brown on both sides, then remove to a buttered 9x13 inch baking dish, or similar size.
Quickly brown on both sides, then remove to a buttered 9x13 inch baking dish, or similar size.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
line.annotation: do(ing19, t4, ing20, "seasoned chicken", "season with salt and pepper to taste")

line.originaltext: Place orange slices over the top of the chicken.
line.annotation: combine({ing20, ing6}, ing21, "orange chicken", "place orange on top of chicken")

line.originaltext: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Drain the oil from the skillet, reserving 1/4 cup.
line.annotation: separate(ing21, ing22, "orange chicken", ing23, "1/4 cup oil", "drain oil")

line.originaltext: Heat the reserved oil with the wine over medium heat until reduced by 1/2.
Heat the reserved oil with the wine over medium heat until reduced by 1/2.
line.annotation: cook(ing24, t3, ing25, "hot oil and wine", "heat over medium heat")

line.originaltext: Heat the reserved oil with the wine over medium heat until reduced by 1/2.
Add broth and orange juice, and reduce by 1/2 again.
Add broth and orange juice, and reduce by 1/2 again.
Pour the sauce over the chicken, then drizzle with Grand Marinier.
line.annotation: combine({ing22, ing27}, ing28, "saucy chicken", "pour sauce over chicken")

line.originaltext: Pour the sauce over the chicken, then drizzle with Grand Marinier.
Bake for 20 to 25 minutes in the preheated oven, until bubbly.
line.annotation: cook(ing29, t5, ing30, "baked chicken", "20 to 25 minutes")

line.originaltext: Bake for 20 to 25 minutes in the preheated oven, until bubbly.
